resources.string: Share the information that you are infected
Sharing information that you are infected and sending your keys will help others who may have been exposed.
Enter the code you received after a positive COVID-19 test to inform others.
The date helps application determine the time period during which you were contagious.

Your phone needs to use Bluetooth to securely record and share randomly generated reference codes with other devices in close proximity.

Stop COVID-19 can notify you if you have been in proximity to persons who subsequently report to have been tested positive for Covid-19.

The date, duration, and signal strength associated with an exposure will be shared with the app.
You can choose to turn off these notifications at any time.

Application notifications are designed to warn you if you have been exposed to users who subsequently report as testing positive for Covid-19.\n\nExposure notifications rely on the sharing and collecting of randomly generated reference codes. These codes are arbitrary strings of numbers that will not identify you to other users. They are frequently changed during the day in order to protect your privacy.

Next steps:

Given the close contact and the level of risk, it is recommended that you make a Laboratory Finding on COVID-19 yourself.

Here you can find a list of places where you can do testing.

Next steps:

Monitor symptoms regularly and measure body temperature.
Self-isolation for 14 days is recommended for the safety of others around you.
%s you were in proximity to a person who shared their positive Covid-19 test result.
Share your randomly assigned identifiers with the "Stop COVID-19" application?

Your randomly generated codes from the past 14 days will be used to notify other app users you have come in contact with about possible exposure to Covid-19.\n\nThe date and time of your contact will be shared with the users that you made contact with, but your identity will not be shared with others.
How do COVID-19 exposure notifications work?

Application notifications are designed to notify you if you are exposed to another user of the application who subsequently reports his or her positive laboratory findings through the application.

You can choose to turn off notifications at any time.

Exposure notices rely on the sharing and collection of random identifiers. Identifiers are a series of numbers that do not identify you to other users and are changed several times a day to protect your privacy.
The application does not record contacts with other devices in the vicinity.
Keep in touch with other devices nearby anonymously and without saving your location.
The notification will be received only by the persons who have been exposed.
Thank you for caring for others!
Thank you for caring for others.
Take care of yourself and others!
You were in a high risk contact with an infected person.
You were in medium risk contact with an infected person.
You were in contact with an infected person.
Stay at home and call your doctor, he will give you further instructions. Tell him that you have this application installed.

Check your symptoms regularly during the next two weeks. Wear a mask when leaving your home and avoid contact with the elderly. If you develop symptoms, stay at home and call your doctor who will give you further instructions. Tell him you have this application installed.

Check your symptoms regularly during the next two weeks. Wear a mask when leaving your home and avoid contact with the elderly. If you develop symptoms, stay at home and call your doctor who will give you further instructions. Tell him you have this application installed.
The application does not collect your personal data, like your name, surname, date of birth, address, telephone number etc.
The application cannot identify you or the people you have been in contact with.
There is no collection of geolocation data (GPS), your movement is not tracked.
The data saved on your device and the connections to the server are encrypted.

In case of infection and with your consent, your keys will be temporarily stored on a server in the Republic of Croatia managed by the Ministry of Health. If you consent to exchange of keys with other European countries, your keys will be temporarily stored on their servers.
New version of the application is available. The new version needs to be downloaded in order to use the application.
The app assigns randomly generated keys to each device
These keys are a random string of characters and do not contain information about your device or you. They rotate several times every hour to keep your privacy protected.
Devices that come into contact exchange their random keys

When you are near another user of the application, mobile phones exchange keys via Bluetooth. This way, the application can track the contacts made without the ability to identify you or the person you were in contact with.
Users who test positive can choose if they want to share their random keys

Users who have a positive laboratory result can send their random keys broadcasted in the previous period to the server, making them available to other users of the application. Random keys are sent by entering the code generated for users by a healthcare professional after they have received a positive laboratory test on COVID-19.
Each device checks if it has had contact with any of the shared keys

The app periodically checks the keys on the server and compares them to the keys saved on your device. This allows the app to determine if you have been exposed to a potential infection risk. Due to the limitations of some manufacturers of mobile devices, if the application is not started occasionally or it is rarely used for a number of days, it is possible that regular daily exposure check is stopped. The application will continue to exchange keys with other devices, but you may not receive exposure notification in timely manner. To prevent this, open the app once a day. Google and Apple are working with mobile device manufacturers to avoid this limitation.
User is notified if there is a positive match

If you have been in contact with a user who tested positive and shared their keys, the app will send you notification and instructions what to do next. The app does not need or use information where or with whom you came into contact.
Exchange of random keys with other European countries

By giving consent to exchange, random keys of users of other authorized European COVID-19 mobile applications who have shared information about the infection will be processed on your mobile device so that the mobile application can determine if you have been in close contact. Also, in case of infection, your random keys will be sent to the European keys exchange service and processed by authorized COVID-19 mobile applications of other European countries.
Exposure api is not available on this device
Thank you for caring for others!
The application records contacts with other devices in the proximity.
The application does not record contacts with other devices in the proximity.
An error occurred. Please try again later.
Bluetooth and location must be enabled for the Exposure api to function properly
Exchange of random keys with other European countries

By giving consent to exchange, random keys of users of other authorized COVID-19 mobile applications in Europe who have shared information about the infection will be processed on your mobile device so that the mobile application can determine if you have been in close contact. Also, in case of infection, your random keys will be sent to the European keys exchange service and processed by authorized COVID-19 mobile applications of other European countries.\n\nActivation of this setting will ensure that you receive exposure notification when travelling abroad or interacting with users of other authorized COVID-19 mobile application.
Accept keys exchange with other European countries

By accepting the exchange, random keys of users of other authorized European COVID-19 mobile applications who have shared information about their infection will be processed on your mobile device to determine if you were in close contact. Also, in case of infection, your random keys will be sent to the European keys exchange service and processed by authorized COVID-19 mobile applications of other European countries.
